017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link DeterministicSupplier} with additional contractual
037 * requirements.
038 *
039 * <p><strong>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an
040 * {@link Optional} or a {@link
041 * java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},</strong> despite the
042 * deliberate similarities of some method names.</p>
043 *
044 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
045 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
046 * class</a>.</p>
047 *
048 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
049 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
050 *
051 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
052 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
053 *
054 * @see #presence()
055 *
056 * @see #deterministic()
057 *
058 * @see #get()
059 *
060 * @see #optional()
061 */
062@FunctionalInterface
063public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends DeterministicSupplier<T> {
064
065  /**
066   * Invokes the {@link #presence()} method and invokes {@link
067   * Presence#deterministic() deterministic()} on its return value and
068   * returns the result.
069   *
070   * <p>Overrides of this method are <strong>strongly</strong>
071   * discouraged.</p>
072   *
073   * <p>Any (discouraged) overriding of this method should be
074   * undertaken with a sensible override of the {@link #presence()}
075   * method as well.</p>
076   *
077   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link OptionalSupplier}
078   * is known to be deterministic
079   *
080   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
081   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
082   *
083   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
084   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
085   *
086   * @see #presence()
087   *
088   * @see DeterministicSupplier#deterministic()
089   */
090  @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
091  @OverridingDiscouraged
092  public default boolean deterministic() {
093    return this.presence().deterministic();
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
098   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
099   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
100   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
101   * that does occur, including {@link NoSuchElementException} and
102   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
103   * indicate value absence.
104   *
105   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
106   *
107   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
108   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
109   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
110   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
111   * that does occur
112   *
113   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
114   * null}
115   *
116   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
117   * return {@code null}
118   *
119   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
120   * determinism.
121   *
122   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
123   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads,
124   * but the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method of
125   * the supplied {@code handler} may not be.
126   *
127   * @see #get()
128   */
129  @OverridingDiscouraged
130  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
131    try {
132      return this.get();
133    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
134      try {
135        return handler.apply(e);
136      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
137        r.addSuppressed(e);
138        throw r;
139      }
140    }
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}.
145   *
146   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
147   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
148   *
149   * <ul>
150   *
151   * <li><strong>It is deliberately and explicitly permitted for
152   * implementations of this method to return {@code null} for any
153   * reason.</strong> Callers of this method must be appropriately
154   * prepared.</li>
155   *
156   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic
157   * (unless the {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method
158   * returns {@code true})</li>
159   *
160   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate the (possibly
161   * transitory) absence of a value by any of the following means:
162   *
163   * <ul>
164   *
165   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.</li>
166   *
167   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  Normally
168   * such an implementation will also return {@code true} from its
169   * {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method.</li>
170   *
171   * </ul></li>
172   *
173   * </ul>
174   *
175   * @return a value, which may be {@code null}
176   *
177   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate (usually
178   * transitory) absence
179   *
180   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate (usually
181   * permanent) absence
182   *
183   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
184   * return {@code null}, even in the normal course of events.
185   *
186   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
187   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
188   *
189   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
190   * determinism.  An ideal implementation should be idempotent.  If
191   * the {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method returns
192   * {@code true}, then any implementation of this method must be
193   * deterministic.
194   *
195   * @see #presence()
196   *
197   * @see #deterministic()
198   */
199  @Override
200  public T get();
201
202  /**
203   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link
204   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
205   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
206   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
207   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
208   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
209   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
210   * instances that are used to indicate value absence.
211   *
212   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
213   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
214   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
215   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()} method,
216   * including {@link NoSuchElementException} and {@link
217   * UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
218   * indicate value absence.</p>
219   *
220   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
221   *
222   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
223   *
224   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
225   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
226   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
227   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
228   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
229   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
230   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
231   * instances that are used to indicate value absence
232   *
233   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
234   * null}
235   *
236   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
237   * return {@code null}.
238   *
239   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
240   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
241   *
242   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
243   * determinism.
244   *
245   * @see #get()
246   */
247  @OverridingDiscouraged
248  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
249    T value;
250    try {
251      value = this.get();
252    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
253      try {
254        return handler.apply(null, e);
255      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
256        r.addSuppressed(e);
257        throw r;
258      }
259    }
260    return handler.apply(value, null);
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
265   * on the supplied {@code action} with the return value of an
266   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
267   * null}, unless the {@link #get()} method throws either a {@link
268   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
269   * UnsupportedOperationException}, indicating value absence, in
270   * which case no action is taken.
271   *
272   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
273   * take; must not be {@code null}
274   *
275   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
276   *
277   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
278   * determinism.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
281   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
282   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
283   * accept(Object)} method may not be
284   *
285   * @see #get()
286   */
287  @Convenience
288  @OverridingDiscouraged
289  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
290    T value;
291    try {
292      value = this.get();
293    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
294      return;
295    }
296    action.accept(value);
297  }
298
299  /**
300   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
301   * on the supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
302   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
303   * null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates value absence
304   * by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
305   * UnsupportedOperationException}, invokes the {@link Runnable#run()
306   * run()} method of the supplied {@code absentAction} instead.
307   *
308   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
309   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
310   *
311   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
312   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
313   *
314   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
315   * absentAction} is {@code null}
316   *
317   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
318   * determinism.
319   *
320   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
321   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
322   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
323   * accept(Object)} method may not be and the supplied {@link
324   * Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run() run()} method may not be
325   *
326   * @see #get()
327   */
328  @Convenience
329  @OverridingDiscouraged
330  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
331    T value;
332    try {
333      value = this.get();
334    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
335      try {
336        absentAction.run();
337        return;
338      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
339        r.addSuppressed(e);
340        throw r;
341      }
342    }
343    presentAction.accept(value);
344  }
345
346  /**
347   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
348   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
349   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
350   *
351   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
352   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
353   *
354   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
355   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
356   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
357   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
358   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
359   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
360   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
361   * methods.</p>
362   *
363   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
364   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
365   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
366   *
367   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
368   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
369   *
370   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
371   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
372   * multiple threads.
373   *
374   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
375   * determinism.
376   *
377   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
378   *
379   * @see #get()
380   */
381  @Convenience
382  @OverridingDiscouraged
383  public default Optional<T> optional() {
384    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
385  }
386
387  /**
388   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
389   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
390   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
391   * result.
392   *
393   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
394   *
395   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
396   *
397   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
398   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
399   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
400   * supplied {@code handler}
401   *
402   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
403   * null}
404   *
405   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
406   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
407   *
408   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
409   * determinism.
410   *
411   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
412   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
413   *
414   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
415   *
416   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
417   */
418  @Convenience
419  @OverridingDiscouraged
420  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
421    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
422  }
423
424  /**
425   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
426   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
427   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
428   * result.
429   *
430   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
431   *
432   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
433   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
434   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
435   * with the supplied {@code handler}
436   *
437   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
438   * null}
439   *
440   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
441   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
442   *
443   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
444   * determinism.
445   *
446   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
447   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
448   *
449   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
450   *
451   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
452   */
453  @Convenience
454  @OverridingDiscouraged
455  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
456    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
457  }
458
459  /**
460   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
461   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
462   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
463   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
464   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}.
465   *
466   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
467   *
468   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
469   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
470   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
471   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
472   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}
473   *
474   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
475   * return {@code null}.
476   *
477   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
478   * determinism.
479   *
480   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
481   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
482   *
483   * @see #get()
484   */
485  @Convenience
486  @OverridingDiscouraged
487  public default T orElse(final T other) {
488    try {
489      return this.get();
490    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
491      return other;
492    }
493  }
494
495  /**
496   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
497   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
498   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
499   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
500   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
501   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}.
502   *
503   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
504   * {@code null}
505   *
506   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
507   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
508   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
509   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
510   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
511   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}
512   *
513   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
514   * null}
515   *
516   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
517   * return {@code null}.
518   *
519   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
520   * determinism.
521   *
522   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
523   * msut be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
524   * {@link Supplier#get() get()} method of the supplied {@code supplier}
525   * may not be
526   *
527   * @see #get()
528   */
529  @Convenience
530  @OverridingDiscouraged
531  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
532    try {
533      return this.get();
534    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
535      try {
536        return supplier.get();
537      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
538        r.addSuppressed(e);
539        throw r;
540      }
541    }
542  }
543
544  /**
545   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
546   * may be {@code null}.
547   *
548   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
549   * may be {@code null}
550   *
551   * @exception NoSuchElementException if value absence was indicated
552   * by the {@link #get()} method
553   *
554   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
555   * return {@code null}.
556   *
557   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
558   * determinism.
559   *
560   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
561   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
562   *
563   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
564   */
565  @Convenience
566  @OverridingDiscouraged
567  public default T orElseThrow() {
568    try {
569      return this.get();
570    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
571      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
572    }
573  }
574
575  /**
576   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
577   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
578   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
579   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
580   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
581   * Supplier#get() get()} method.
582   *
583   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
584   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
585   *
586   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
587   * must not be {@code null}
588   *
589   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
590   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
591   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
592   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
593   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
594   * Supplier#get() get()} method
595   *
596   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
597   * null}
598   *
599   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link #get()} method
600   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
601   * UnsupportedOperationException}
602   *
603   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
604   * return {@code null}.
605   *
606   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
607   * determinism.
608   *
609   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
610   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
611   *
612   * @see #get()
613   */
614  @Convenience
615  @OverridingDiscouraged
616  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
617    try {
618      return this.get();
619    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
620      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
621      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
622        throwable.initCause(e);
623      } else {
624        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
625      }
626      throw throwable;
627    }
628  }
629
630  /**
631   * Returns an {@link Presence} denoting the presence of values
632   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
633   * method.
634   *
635   * <p>Overrides of this method must not call {@link
636   * #deterministic()} or undefined behavior (such as an infinite
637   * loop) may result.</p>
638   *
639   * <p>Overrides of this method must be compatible with the
640   * implementation of the {@link #get()} method.  Specifically:</p>
641   *
642   * <ul>
643   *
644   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
645   * Presence#PRESENT}, then the implementation of the {@link #get()}
646   * method must not throw either a {@link NoSuchElementException} nor
647   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
648   *
649   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link Presence#ABSENT},
650   * then it is expected that any invocation of the {@link #get()}
651   * method will throw either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an
652   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  If an implementation of
653   * the {@link #get()} method instead returns a value, contrary to
654   * these requirements, then the value must be treated as irrelevant
655   * or undefined.</li>
656   *
657   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
658   * Presence#UNKNOWN}, then there are no additional requirements
659   * placed upon the implementation of the {@link #get()} method
660   * besides those defined in {@linkplain #get() its existing
661   * contract}.</li>
662   *
663   * </ul>
664   *
665   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@link
666   * Presence#UNKNOWN}.</p>
667   *
668   * @return an {@link Presence} denoting the presence of values
669   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
670   * method
671   *
672   * @nullability This method does not, and its (encouraged) overrides
673   * must not, return {@code null}.
674   *
675   * @idempotency This method is, and its (encouraged) overrides must
676   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
677   *
678   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (encouraged) overrides must
679   * be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
680   */
681  @OverridingEncouraged
682  public default Presence presence() {
683    return Presence.UNKNOWN;
684  }
685
686  /**
687   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
688   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
689   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
690   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
691   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
692   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
693   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method.
694   *
695   * <p>Note that this means the sole element of the {@link Stream}
696   * that is returned may be {@code null}.  If this is undesirable,
697   * consider invoking {@link Optional#stream() stream()} on the
698   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method instead.</p>
699   *
700   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
701   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
702   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
703   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
704   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
705   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
706   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method
707   *
708   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
709   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
710   *
711   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
712   * determinism.
713   *
714   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
715   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
716   *
717   * @see #get()
718   */
719  @Convenience
720  @OverridingDiscouraged
721  public default Stream<T> stream() {
722    try {
723      return Stream.of(this.get());
724    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
725      return Stream.empty();
726    }
727  }
728
729  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
730    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
731      return null;
732    } else {
733      throw e;
734    }
735  }
736
737
738  /**
739   * A token indicating deterministic presence or absence.
740   *
741   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
742   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
743   *
744   * @see OptionalSupplier#presence()
745   */
746  public static enum Presence {
747
748    /**
749     * An {@link Presence} indicating non-deterministic presence or
750     * absence.
751     */
752    UNKNOWN(false),
753
754    /**
755     * An {@link Presence} indicating deterministic absence.
756     */
757    ABSENT(true),
758
759    /**
760     * An {@link Presence} indicating deterministic presence.
761     */
762    PRESENT(true);
763
764    private final boolean deterministic;
765
766    private Presence(final boolean deterministic) {
767      this.deterministic = deterministic;
768    }
769
770    /**
771     * Returns {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
772     * {@link Presence} is deterministic.
773     *
774     * @return {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
775     * {@link Presence} is deterministic
776     *
777     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
778     *
779     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
780     * multiple threads.
781     */
782    public final boolean deterministic() {
783      return this.deterministic;
784    }
785
786  }
787
788}
